description: This is a State scheme under which senior citizens of Haryana domicile in the age group of 60 years and above are given Old Age Samman Allowance as per eligibility criteria laid down in the rules of the scheme.

procedures.step_description: Through E-disha Center
Atal Seva Kendra

title: Old Age Samman Allowance

criteria.description: Haryana domicile
Age 60 years and above

description: This is a State scheme under which destitute or deserted women and widow of 18 years of age or above are given pension as per eligibility criteria laid down in the rules of the scheme.

procedures.step_description: Through E-disha Center
Atal Seva Kendra

title: Widow Pension Scheme

criteria.description: 18 years of age or above

description: This is a State scheme under which disabled person of Haryana domicile with a minimum 60% disability and are 18 years of age and above, are given pension as per eligibility criteria laid down in the rules of the scheme.

procedures.step_description: Through E-disha Center
Atal Seva Kendra

title: Disability Pension Scheme

criteria.description: Haryana domicile
minimum 60% disability
18 years of age and above

description: This is a State Scheme under which parents/guardians of the children upto the age of 21 years who are deprived of proper care because of the death or long imprisonment of their parents, long illness or mental retardation, are paid financial assistance subject to the maximum for two children of one family as per eligibility criteria laid down in the scheme.

procedures.step_description: Apply through E-disha Center
Apply through Atal Seva Kendra

title: Financial Assistance to Destitute Children Scheme(FADC)

criteria.description: Deprived of proper care because of the death or long imprisonment of their parents
Long illness or mental retardation of parents
Maximum two children of one family

description: Under this scheme mentally retarded and multiple disabled children who are in the age group of 0-18 years who are not able to attend formal education, training etc. due to their disability is given financial aid. They are totally dependent on their parents and relatives and need constant supervision and care of their families. Financial Assistance shall be admissible under the scheme to every such disabled child in the family of the applicant.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: mentally retarded and multiple disabled children who are in the age group of 0-18 years

procedures.step_description: Through E-disha Center, Atal Seva Kendra

title: Financial Assistance to Non School Going Disabled Children(less than 18 Years)

criteria.description: not able to attend formal education
totally dependent on their parents and relatives

description: Dwarf persons who are living in various parts of the State are being given allowance. A male person with 3 feet 8 inches or less height and a female with 3 feet\n3 inches or less height (equivalent to 70% handicapped) is entitled to monthly allowance.

procedures.step_description: Through E-disha Center, Atal Seva Kendra

title: Allowance to Dwarfs

criteria.description: A male person with 3 feet 8 inches or less height and a female with 3 feet 3 inches or less height (equivalent to 70% handicapped)

description: Eunuchs who are living in various parts of the State, should not be less than 18 years and provide certificate from the Civil Surgeon in support of being an Eunuch.

procedures.step_description: Through E-disha Center, Atal Seva Kendra

title: Allowance to Eunuchs

criteria.description: Eunuchs who are living in various parts of the State

description: State Govt. is implementing Rajiv Gandhi Parivar Bima Yojna w.e.f. 1.4.2006. Under this Scheme compensation is given in case of accidental death/ permanent disability to all in the age group of 18-60 years, who are domicile of Haryana and whose name appears in the Voters list or who hold Ration Card issued by the competent authority and are not income Tax Payee and Govt. employee.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: All in the age group of 18-60 years, who are domicile of Haryana and whose name appears in the Voters list or who hold Ration Card issued by the competent authority and are not income Tax Payee and Govt. employee.

procedures.step_description: Through E-disha Center, Atal Seva Kendra

title: Rajiv Gandhi Pariwar Bima Yojna

description: The Prime Minister’s New 15 Point Programme for the Welfare of Minorities was announced in June, 2006. It provides that a post-matric scholarship scheme for meritorious\nstudents from minority communities would be implemented.

procedures.step_description: Through E-disha Center, Atal Seva Kendra

title: Post-Matric Scholarship

criteria.description: Meritorious Students

description: The objective of the Scheme is to provide financial assistance to the poor and meritorious students belonging to minority communities to enable them to pursue professional and technical courses.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: poor and meritorious students belonging to minority communities

procedures.step_description: Through E-disha Center, Atal Seva Kendra

title: Merit Cum Means

description: The Prime Minister’s New 15 Point Programme for the Welfare of Minorities was announced in June, 2006. It provides that a pre-matric scholarship scheme for meritorious students from minority communities would be implemented.

procedures.step_description: Through E-disha Center, Atal Seva Kendra

title: Pre-Matric Scholarship

description: Centrally sponsored scheme providing financial incentive to eligible SC/ST girl students for secondary education. The incentive is given in the form of a Time Deposit which can be withdrawn when the girl turns eighteen, provided she meets the required academic criteria.  The scheme also covers all girls passing Middle standard Examination from Kasturba Gandhi BalikaVidyalya regardless of their caste/religion.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Girls passing Middle standard Examination from Kasturba Gandhi BalikaVidyalya irrespective of caste/religion

procedures.step_description: Online application submission at http://www.scholarships.gov.in
Printed copy of application form and documents submission to Head of the Institute
Verification and forwarding of application by Head of Institute to DDHE
Online verification and cross-checking by DDHE
Return of verified forms by DDHE to schools and forwarding of Verified Candidate List to the Directorate

title: National Scheme of Incentive to Girls for Secondary Education (NSIGSE) (CSS)
documents: Latest Bank Statement of the Students Bank Account
SC / ST Category Certificate (Issued by an officer not below the rank of Tehsildar)
Middle Pass Certificate from KGBV (in case of General Category Girls)

criteria.description: Passing the Middle Standard Examination
Age should not have completed sixteen years as on 31st March of the year
Studying for two years regularly in some Government, Government-aided or local body High/Sr. Sec. School and passed the Matriculation Examination (for withdrawal of incentive)

description: Under this scheme, the scholarship will be awarded for 10 months in an academic year, to the SC Students of Class 9th & 10th, studying in any Govt. / Recognized School, whose parents/guardians annual income from all sources does not exceed Rs 2,50,000/-. It will be renewed for class X after the student passes class IX, subject to good conduct and regularity in attendance. Rates of Scholarship Item Day Scholars Hostellers Scholarship for 10 Months Rs 225/-p.m. Rs 525/-p.m. Books & Ad-Hoc Grant Rs 750/-p.a. Rs 1000/-p.a.

procedures.step_description: The printed copy of the Online Scholarship Form, along with all requisite documents, needs to be submitted by the student to his / her Head of the Institute.
The Institution will further forward the duly attested printed form along with the Verified Candidate List(s) to the concerned DDHE for online verification & cross-checking.
After successful online verification, the DDHE shall retain the hard copies of the students of Private Recognized Institution(s), and return the remaining forms to the concerned schools.
The DDHE also need to forward the Verified Candidate List(s) in r/o their respective district(s) to this Directorate.

funding_pattern:
Scholarship for 10 Months: Day Scholars - Rs 225/-p.m., Hostellers - Rs 525/-p.m.
Books & Ad-Hoc Grant: Day Scholars - Rs 750/-p.a., Hostellers - Rs 1000/-p.a.
title: Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme for SC Students (9th &10th) CSS.

criteria.description: Students of Class 9th & 10th
Studying in any Govt. / Recognized School
Parents/guardians annual income from all sources does not exceed Rs 2,50,000/-

documents: Latest Bank Statement of the Students Bank Account
SC Category Certificate (Issued by an officer not below the rank of Tehsildar)
Income Certificate of Parent / Guardian (Issued by an officer not below the rank of Tehsildar)

description: Under this scheme, the scholarship will be awarded for 10 months in an academic year, to the ST Students of Class 9th & 10th, studying in any Govt. / Recognized School, whose parents/guardians annual income from all sources does not exceed Rs 2,00,000/-. It will be renewed for class X after the student passes class IX, subject to good conduct and regularity in attendance. Rates of Scholarship Item Day Scholars Hostellers Scholarship for 10 Months Rs 150/-p.m. Rs 350/-p.m. Books & Ad-Hoc Grant Rs 750/-p.a. Rs 1000/-p.a.

procedures.step_description: Students need to submit the printed copy of the Online Scholarship Form along with requisite documents to the Head of the Institute.
Institutions forward the attested printed form and Verified Candidate List to the concerned DDHE for online verification.
DDHE retains hard copies of students from Private Recognized Institutions and returns the remaining forms to the concerned schools.
DDHE forwards the Verified Candidate List to the Directorate.

funding_pattern: Rs 150/-p.m. for Day Scholars and Rs 350/-p.m. for Hostellers for 10 months, along with an additional Books & Ad-Hoc Grant of Rs 750/-p.a. for Day Scholars and Rs 1000/-p.a. for Hostellers.
title: Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme for ST Students (9th &10th) CSS
documents: Latest Bank Statement of the Students Bank Account
ST Category Certificate (Issued by an officer not below the rank of Tehsildar)
Income Certificate of Parent / Guardian (Issued by an officer not below the rank of Tehsildar)

criteria.description: Studying in 9th or 10th standard in any Govt. / Recognized School
Parents/guardians annual income from all sources does not exceed Rs 2,00,000/-

description: Under this scheme the scholarship will be given to those students from 1st to 10th classes whose parents Annual Income does not exceed to Rs 2,50,000/-. The scholarship will be awarded @ Rs 100/- per month for 10 months for Day Scholars and for Hostelers Rs 500/- per month for 10 months from Class III to X and Rs 500 per student per annum one time adhoc grant is also given under this scheme (Revised w.e.f. 2017-18). The scholarship amount will be payable from the date of joining to the date of leaving the school, excluding the period of vacation, which will be about 10 months in a year except in the cases where the students enters late or leaves early in the midst of academic year.

procedures.step_description: Students of Class 9th& 10th need to apply online.

For Class 1st to 8th, the DDHEs would collect the budget demands from the schools and the BPEOs within their district and submit the consolidated Budget Demand of their respective Districts, to this Directorate before 15th September every year.
The printed copy of the Online Scholarship Form, along with all requisite documents, needs to be submitted by the student to his / her Head of the Institute.
The Institution will further forward the duly attested printed form along with the Verified Candidate List(s) to the concerned DDHE for online verification & cross-checking.
After successful online verification, the DDHE shall retain the hard copies of the students of Private Recognized Institution(s), and return the remaining forms to the concerned schools.
The DDHE also need to forward the Verified Candidate List(s) to this Directorate.

funding_pattern: Rs 100/- per month for 10 months for Day Scholars and for Hostelers Rs 500/- per month for 10 months from Class III to X and Rs 500 per student per annum one time adhoc grant
title: Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme for OBC Students (1st to 10th) (CSS)

criteria.description: Students from 1st to 10th classes
Parents Annual Income does not exceed Rs 2,50,000/-

documents: Latest Bank Statement of the Student's Bank Account seeded/linked with students Aadhaar No. for DBT purpose.
OBC Category Certificate (Issued by an officer not below the rank of Tehsildar)
Income Certificate of Parent / Guardian (Issued by an officer not below the rank of Tehsildar)

description: Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme to SC students whose parents/guardians annual income does not exceed Rs 2,50,000/-, for all courses, in Govt./Govt. Aided/ Recognized Private Recognized Institutions, as regular students.

procedures.step_description: Submit the Online Scholarship Form.
Submit printed copy of online form with documents to Head of Institute.
Institute forwards attested form and Verified Candidate List to DDHE (for schools) or Directorate (for colleges/universities).

title: Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme to SC students (CSS).

criteria.description: SC students whose parents/guardians annual income from all sources does not exceed Rs 2,50,000/-
Pursuing studies in Govt./Govt. Aided/ Recognized Private Recognized Institutions as regular students.

documents: Previous Year(s) Result Card(s) from Matric onwards
Latest Bank Statement of the Students Bank Account
Fee Structure approved by the University / Board / State Govt. / Centre Govt.

description: Under this Scheme, all ST students whose parents/guardians annual income from all sources does not exceed Rs 2,50,000/-, are eligible for full scholarship (i.e. Maintenance Allowance + Compulsory Fee) for all courses, provided they are pursuing their studies in Govt. / Govt. Aided / Recognized Private Recognized Institutions, as regular students.

procedures.step_description: Submit the printed copy of the Online Scholarship Form along with all requisite documents to the Head of the Institute.

The Institution will forward the duly attested printed form along with the Verified Candidate List(s) to the concerned DDHE (in case of Govt. / Private Recognized Schools within state) & to this Directorate (in case of Universities / Private Recognized Colleges / Professional / Technical / Other Institutes / All Out of state institutes), for online verification & safekeeping.

title: Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme to ST students (CSS).
documents: Previous Year(s) Result Card(s) from Matric onwards
Latest Bank Statement of the Students Bank Account
Fee Structure approved by the University / Board / State Govt . / Centre Govt.

criteria.description: Students whose parents/guardians annual income from all sources does not exceed Rs 2,50,000/-

description: Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme to OBC students (CSS). Under this Scheme, all employed OBC students whose income combined with the income of their parents/guardians and unemployed OBC students whose parents/guardians income from all sources does not exceed Rs 1,50,000/-, per annum are eligible for scholarship (i.e. Maintenance Allowance + Compulsory Fee) for all courses, provided they are pursuing their studies in Govt. / Govt. Aided / Recognized Private Recognized Institutions, as regular students.

procedures.step_description: Submit the printed copy of the Online Scholarship Form along with all requisite documents to the Head of the Institute.

The Institution will forward the duly attested printed form (after successful online verification) along with the Verified Candidate List(s) (on the prescribed format) to the concerned DDHE (in case of Govt. / Private Recognized Schools within state) & to this Directorate (in case of Universities / Private Recognized Colleges / Professional / Technical / Other Institutes / All Out of state institutes), for online verification & safekeeping.
Govt. Colleges (within state) need to forward only the Verified Candidate List(s) (on the prescribed format) to this Directorate.

title: Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme to OBC students (CSS)

criteria.description: Employed OBC students whose income combined with the income of their parents/guardians does not exceed Rs 1,50,000/- per annum
Unemployed OBC students whose parents/guardians income from all sources does not exceed Rs 1,50,000/- per annum
Pursuing studies in Govt. / Govt. Aided / Recognized Private Recognized Institutions as regular students

documents: Previous Year Result Cards from Matric onwards
Latest Bank Statement of the Students Bank Account
Fee Structure approved by the University / Board / State Govt. / Centre Govt.

description: Provides financial assistance to students belonging to the General Category (excluding SC, ST, and OBC) with a family income less than Rs. 1,00,000/- per annum, for pursuing post-matriculation studies in government institutions. Covers full scholarship for various courses including Medicine, Engineering, Technology, Management, and others, with varying monthly rates for day scholars and hostellers.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: General Category students whose family income is less than Rs. 1,00,000/- per annum

procedures.step_description: Students submit the printed online scholarship form along with documents to the Head of the Institute.
Institutions forward the verified forms and candidate list to DDHE and the Directorate.
Offline applications are not accepted.

title: Dr. Ambedkar Post-Matric Scholarship for Economically Backward Classes (CSS)
funding_pattern: Full scholarship covering maintenance allowance and compulsory fees.

criteria.description: Income from all sources does not exceed Rs. 1,00,000/- per annum.

description: Scholarship is awarded to Seven students (SC-6 & ST-1) of the State, admitted in Class 9th at the GSSS Bharmour, Chamba, on the basis of merit list of middle standard exams. The Scheme is tenable from Class 9th to 10+2.

procedures.step_description: Submit the printed copy of the Online Scholarship Form along with all requisite documents to the Head of the Institute.
The Institution will forward the duly attested printed form along with the Verified Candidate List(s) to the concerned DDHE for online verification & cross-checking.
After successful online verification, the DDHE shall return the forms to the concerned school and forward the Verified Candidate List(s) to the Directorate.

funding_pattern: Rs 2500/-p.a. for Fee & Stationery, Rs 700/-p.a. for Boarding & Lodging, Rs 200/-p.a. Out of Pocket Allowance. Honorarium @ Rs 10,000/- p.a. per student (for SC Students) & @ Rs 8,000/- p.a. per student for (SC Students) to the teachers.
title: Upgradation of Merit of SC/ST students (CSS) (Only for GSSS Bharmour, Chamba).

criteria.description: Admitted in Class 9th at the GSSS Bharmour, Chamba
Based on merit list of middle standard exams

documents: Previous Year(s) Result Card(s) from Matric onwards
Latest Bank Statement of the Students Bank Account
SC/ ST Category Certificate (Issued by an officer not below the rank of Tehsildar)

description: Scholarship for Degree / Post-graduate level Technical Professional Courses from Recognized Institutions for minority students (Muslim, Sikh, Christian, Buddhist).  Annual income limit of Rs. 2.50 Lacs and minimum 50% marks are required. Online application at http://www.scholarships.gov.in.  Rates: Hostlers - Rs. 10,000/year maintenance, Rs. 20,000/year course fee. Day Scholars - Rs. 5,000/year maintenance, Rs. 20,000/year course fee. Full course fee for NIT Hamirpur and IIT Mandi. Online application, print and submit with documents to the Head of the Institute.

procedures.step_description: Apply online at http://www.scholarships.gov.in
Print the application form.
Submit the printed form with documents to the Head of the Institute.

funding_pattern: Scholarship covering maintenance allowance and course fees
title: Merit cum means Scholarship Scheme for Students belonging to Minority Community (CSS)
documents: Attested Certificate of Last Exam Passed

criteria.description: Annual income of parent/guardian should not exceed Rs. 2.50 Lacs.
Minimum 50% marks in previous qualifying exam.

description: Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme for minority community students from class XI to Ph.D. level in government or recognized private institutions, including technical and vocational courses.  The annual income of the parent or guardian should not exceed Rs 2.00 Lacs, and the student should have at least 50% marks in the previous final examination.  Students must have passed from Govt. / Govt. Aided institutions.  Scholarships cover admission/tuition fees and a maintenance allowance.

procedures.step_description: Apply online at http://www.scholarships.gov.in
Submit the printed online application form with required documents to the Head of the Institute.

title: Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme to students belonging to Minority community (CSS).

criteria.description: Students belonging to the Minority Groups (Muslim, Sikh, Christian, Buddhist, Jain, Parsi).
Annual income of parent/guardian should not exceed Rs. 2.00 Lacs.
Minimum 50% marks in the previous final examination.
Must pass the examination from Govt. / Govt. Aided institutions.

documents: Attested Certificate of Last Exam Passed

description: This Scholarship is given to 18 meritorious girl students belonging to Minority community (Muslim - 08, Sikh - 04,Christian - 02, Budhhist - 04 Total - 18 students) who secured 55% and above marks in Matriculation Examination conducted by the H.P. Board of School Education, Dharamshala, and the family income of the student from all sources should be less than Rs 1,00,000/- (Rupees One Lakh only ). Under this scheme, an amount Rs 12,000/- will be awarded as scholarship by the Government of India, which will be released in two instalments of Rs 6,000/- each. The first instalment will be released after sanction of Scholarship and the second instalment will be released when the student will submit proof of passing Class XI, and admission to Class XII in the office of the Foundation.

procedures.step_description: Apply through the online portal.
Submit proof of passing Class XI for the second installment.

title: Maulana Azad National Scholarship Scheme for Meritorious Girls students belonging to Minorities(CSS).

criteria.description: 55% and above marks in Matriculation Examination
Family income less than Rs. 1,00,000/-
Belonging to Minority Communities (Muslim, Sikh, Christian, Buddhist)

description: Scholarships awarded to meritorious students of economically weaker sections to prevent dropout at class VIII and encourage secondary education.  Students with parental income below Rs 150000/- are eligible. Selection via SCERT, Solan exam in August. Rs 6,000/- p.a. scholarship for classes IX-XII in Govt/aided/local body schools. Renewal subject to good conduct and attendance. Implemented by Ministry of Human Resource Development through SCERT, Solan.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Meritorious students of economically weaker sections

procedures.step_description: Apply for the scholarship before the deadline.
Appear for the examination conducted by the SCERT, Solan.
Maintain good conduct and regular attendance for renewal.

sponsors.sponsor_type: Ministry of Human Resource Development, Govt. of India

title: National Means-Cum-Merit Scholarship (CSS)

criteria.description: Parental income from all sources not more than Rs 150000/-
Selected through an examination conducted by SCERT, Solan.

description: a)Scholarship Scheme (Trust Fund): 1,000 Scholarships for differently-abled students for degree/post-graduate professional/technical courses. Online application (www.nhfdc.nic.in) anytime. Hard copy to National Handicapped Finance & Development Corporation (NHFDC). Reimbursements of Non-Refundable fees (limits apply). b)Scholarship Scheme (National Fund): 500 Scholarships for students with disabilities for post-matric professional/technical courses (1+ year duration). Online application (www.nhfdc.nic.in) and hard copy to NHFDC. Scholarship for hostellers/day scholars. Course fee reimbursed up to Rs 10,000/ p.a. c)Post Matric/Pre Matric Scholarship: Online application (http://www.scholarships.gov.in).

procedures.step_description: Apply online at www.nhfdc.nic.in and submit a hard copy to NHFDC.
Apply online at http://www.scholarships.gov.in

title: Scholarship to disabled Students(CSS).

criteria.description: Monthly income of the beneficiary / parent / guardian should not be more than Rs 25,000/- (Rs 3.00 Lac p.a.) from all sources.
Monthly income of the beneficiary / parent / guardian should not be more than Rs 15,000/- (Rs 1.80 Lac p.a.) from all sources.

description: Scholarship scheme for DNTs with family income less than Rs. 2.0 lacs per annum. Aims to improve educational empowerment for those not covered under SC/ST/OBC.  Rates: Class I-VIII: Rs. 1000/student/10 months, Class IX-X: Rs. 1500/student/10 months.

procedures.step_description: Submit online application form.
Print the online application form and submit it along with required documents to the Head of Institute.
Institutes forward the verified candidate list to DDHE & Directorate.
Government colleges forward the verified candidate list to the Directorate.

title: Dr. Ambedkar Pre-Matric Scholarship for DNTs (CSS)

criteria.description: Family income less than Rs. 2.0 lacs per annum.

documents: Passport Size Photograph with signatures (Self Attested)
Previous Year(s) Result Card(s) from Matric onwards (Attested by the Competent Authority)
Latest Bank Statement of the Students Bank Account
Income Certificate (in original) of Parent / Guardian (Issued by an authorized Revenue Officer not below the rank of Tehsildar)
Fee Structure approved by the University / Board / State Govt. / Centre Govt.

description: Scholarship scheme for Denotified, Nomadic and Semi-Nomadic Tribes (DNTs) with family income less than Rs. 2.0 lacs per annum, not covered under SC/ST/OBC. Aims to improve educational empowerment. Rates vary by course/level of study.

procedures.step_description: Submit the printed copy of online scholarship form alongwith all requisite documents to the Head of Institute.
The Institution will forward the Verified Candidate List(s) (on the prescribed format) to the concerned DDHE & to this Directorate for online verification & safekeeping.
The Govt. Colleges (within state) need to forward only the Verified Candidates List(s) (on the prescribed format) to this Directorate.

title: Dr. Ambedkar Post-Matric Scholarship for DNTs (CSS).

criteria.description: Family income less than Rs. 2.0 lacs per annum.
Not covered under SC/ST/OBC category.

documents: Passport Size Photograph with signatures (Self Attested)
Previous Year(s) Result Card(s) from Matric onwards (Attested by the Competent Authority)
Latest Bank Statement of the Students Bank Account
Income Certificate (in original) of Parent / Guardian (Issued by an authorized Revenue Officer not below the rank of Tehsildar)
Fee Structure approved by the University / Board / State Govt. / Centre Govt.

description: The Scholarship is given to top 1250 meritorious students of Scheduled Caste category after modification from the session 2018-19 declared as such in the result of Matric Examination conducted by the H.P. Board of School Education, Dharamshala, strictly on merit basis to students studying in a recognized (including Professional / Technical) institution within or outside the State.
title: Dr. Ambedkar Medhavi Chattervriti Yojana for SC Student.
documents: Previous Year(s) Result Card(s) from Matric onwards
Latest Bank Statement of the Students Bank Account

criteria.description: top 1250 meritorious students of Scheduled Caste

description: Scholarship for top 1000 meritorious OBC students in Matriculation examination conducted by HP Board. Rs. 10,000/- per annum. Renewal based on satisfactory performance in previous year.

procedures.step_description: Fill the online application form.
Submit the printed application form with documents to the Head of Institute.
Institute forwards verified forms to DDHE or Directorate.
DDHE retains hard copies of private school students and returns remaining to schools.
DDHE sends verified candidate lists to the Directorate.

title: Dr. Ambedkar Medhavi Chattervriti Yojana for OBC Student

criteria.description: Top 1000 meritorious students of OBC in Matriculation examination.
Satisfactory performance in previous year examination.

description: The Scholarship is given to top 2000 meritorious students of General category declared as such in the result of Matric Examination conducted by the H.P. Board of School Education, Dharamshala, strictly on merit basis to students studying in a recognized (including Professional / Technical) institution within or outside the State. The renewal in 10+2 Class / 2nd Year of course will be subject to satisfactory performance in internal examinations of 10+1 Class / 1st Year Course. The scholarship is given @ Rs 10,000/- p.a.

procedures.step_description: Apply on https://hpepass.cgg.gov.in/
Submit the printed form with the required documents.

title: Swami Vivekanand Utkrisht Chattervriti Yojana
documents: Previous Year Result Cards from Matric onwards

criteria.description: Top 2000 meritorious students of General category in the Matriculation Examination conducted by the H.P. Board of School Education

description: The Scholarship is given to top 100 Girls and top 100 Boys students belonging to the Tribal Community of HP, declared as such in the result of Matric Examination conducted by the H.P. Board of School Education, Dharamshala, strictly on merit basis to students studying in a recognized (including Professional / Technical) institution within or outside the State. The renewal in 10+2 Class / 2nd Year of course will be subject to satisfactory performance in internal examinations of 10+1 Class / 1st Year Course.

procedures.step_description: Submit the printed copy of the Online Scholarship Form along with all requisite documents to the Head of the Institute
The Institution will forward the duly attested printed form along with the Verified Candidate List(s) to the concerned DDHE or the Directorate
DDHE will retain hard copies of Private Recognized School students and return the remaining to the schools
DDHE will forward the Verified Candidate List to the Directorate

title: Thakur Sen Negi Utkrisht Chattervritti Yojna.

criteria.description: belonging to the Tribal Community of HP
Top 100 Girls and top 100 Boys students in Matric Examination
Studying in a recognized institution within or outside the State

documents: Previous Year(s) Result Card(s) from Matric onwards
Latest Bank Statement of the Students Bank Account

description: The scholarship under the Indira Gandhi UttkrishtChhatravritiYojna shall be awarded to the Ten Male Toppers each from the merit list of 10+2 Arts, Science and Commerce, supplied by the H.P. Board of School Education Dharamshala, and to the Ten Toppers (both Male & Female) from the merit lists of B.A. / B.Sc. / B.Com., supplied by the HPU, Shimla, provided they join any academic / professional stream. The rate of the scholarship would be @ Rs 10,000/- p.a. per student. The scholarship shall be renewed every year to the same student(s) till they complete degree/course, subject to the condition of achieving at least 55% marks in the subsequent classes.

procedures.step_description: The printed copy of the Online Scholarship Form (after successful online submission of form), along with all requisite documents, needs to be submitted by the student to his / her Head of the Institute

The Institution will forward the duly attested printed form (after successful online verification) along with the Verified Candidate List(s) (on the prescribed format) to this Directorate (in case of Universities / Private Recognized Colleges / Professional / Technical / Other Institutes), for online verification & safekeeping
The Govt. Colleges (within state) need to forward only the Verified Candidate List(s) (on the prescribed format) to this Directorate

title: Indira Gandhi Utkrisht Chattervriti Yojana for Post Plus Two Students.

criteria.description: Ten Male Toppers each from the merit list of 10+2 Arts, Science and Commerce, supplied by the H.P. Board of School Education Dharamshala
Ten Toppers (both Male & Female) from the merit lists of B.A. / B.Sc. / B.Com., supplied by the HPU, Shimla
provided they join any academic / professional stream
achieving at least 55% marks in the subsequent classes

documents: Previous Year(s) Result Card(s) from Matric onwards
Latest Bank Statement of the Students Bank Account

description: State-sponsored scheme providing scholarships to meritorious girl students. Top 2000 girl students of 10+2 in all streams receive Rs 15000/- per year, renewable until degree completion. Scholarship based on passing ratio and merit list from HP Board of School Education. Online application required, printed copy to be submitted to the institution. Specific documents required include photo, Aadhaar card, bonafide certificate, result cards, and bank statement.

procedures.step_description: Online application submission
Printed copy submission to the institution
Verification by institution
Forwarding of verified application to Directorate

title: Kalpana Chawla Chhatravriti Yojna

criteria.description: Top 2000 meritorious girl students of 10+2 of all study groups (Science, Arts, and Commerce)

description: Under this Scheme, a one-time incentive / award of Rs 75000/- will be given to all Himachali students, who are selected and take admission for a degree course in any Indian Institute of Technology (IITs) or All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMSs) or for a Post Graduate Diploma Course in any Indian Institute of Management (IIMs). Indian School of Mines (ISM) Dhanbad at Jharkhand & Indian Institute of Science (IISc) at Bangalore, have also been added to the list of institution eligible for award under this scheme w.e.f. 2014-15.

procedures.step_description: The printed copy of the Online Scholarship Form (after successful online submission of form), along with all requisite documents, needs to be submitted by the student to his / her Head of the Institute.

The Institution will forward the duly attested printed form (after successful online verification) along with the Verified Candidate List(s) (on the prescribed format) to this Directorate, for online verification & safekeeping.

introduced_on: Not specified in the document, introduced w.e.f 2014-15
title: Mukhiya Mantri Protsahan Yojna(One-time Incentive).

criteria.description: Selected and take admission for a degree course in any Indian Institute of Technology (IITs) or All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMSs) or for a Post Graduate Diploma Course in any Indian Institute of Management (IIMs), Indian School of Mines (ISM) Dhanbad at Jharkhand & Indian Institute of Science (IISc) at Bangalore.

documents: Previous Year(s) Result Card(s) from Matric onwards

description: The scholarship under this scheme is given to the Bonafide Himachali Girl Students belonging to Balmiki Families, engaged in unclean occupation, beyond Matric to College Level, for studies from any Govt. or Private Recognized school / college situated within Himachal Pradesh @ Rs 9,000/- p.a.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Bonafide Himachali Girl Students belonging to Balmiki Families engaged in unclean occupation

description: Students belonging to IRDP families and studying in 9th to University level are eligible for this scholarship provided they are pursuing their study in Govt. / Govt. Aided Institutions in H.P. Rates of Scholarship Class Boys Girls 9th & 10th Rs 300/-p.a. Rs 600/-p.a. +1 & +2 Rs 800/-p.a. Rs 800/-p.a. College/University i)Day scholar Rs 1200/-p.a. Rs 1200/-p.a. ii)Hostelers Rs 2400/-p.a. Rs 2400/-p.a.

procedures.step_description: Submit the printed copy of the Online Scholarship Form along with all requisite documents to the Head of the Institute.
The Institution will forward the duly attested printed form along with the Verified Candidate List(s) to the concerned DDHE (in case of Govt. Schools) & to this Directorate (in case of University).
After successful online verification, the DDHE shall retain the hard copies of the students of Private Recognized Institution(s), and return the remaining forms to the concerned schools.
The DDHE also need to forward the Verified Candidate List(s) in r/o their respective district(s) to this Directorate.
The Govt. Colleges (within state) need to forward only the Verified Candidate List(s) to this Directorate.

title: IRDP Scholarship Scheme.
documents: Latest Bank Statement of the Students Bank Account
IRDP / BPL Certificate (Issued by an officer not below the rank of Panchayat Secretary)

Pursuing study in Govt. / Govt. Aided Institutions in H.P.

description: The students who are studying in Sainik School SujanpurTihra and are Bonafide residents of Himachal Pradesh from class VI to XII will be given scholarship at the following rates: Rates of Scholarship S.N. Income Range Rate per annum i. Upto Rs 9220 /-p.m. Rs 18000/- ii. Rs 9221 to Rs 10650/-p.m. Rs 15000/- iii. Rs 10651/- to Rs 11470/-p.m. Rs 12000/- iv. Above Rs 11470/-p.m. Rs 8000/- In addition, the students will be given Dietary Money @ Rs 10/- per day for 295 days. Clothing Allowance @ Rs 1500/- per annum for the first year and Rs 750/- per annum for the subsequent years.

description: This award is made to the Ten Students who are Bonafide residents of H.P. and are studying from VIII to XII in Rashtriya Indian Military College, Dehradun. Two students from each class are eligible for the scholarship. The amount of scholarship is Rs 20,000/- p.a.

procedures.step_description: Submit the printed copy of the Online Scholarship Form along with all requisite documents to the Head of the Institute.
The Institution will forward the duly attested printed form along with the Verified Candidate List(s) to this Directorate for online verification & safekeeping.

description: This is a State Sponsored Scheme started from the year 2010-11, which will be given to the Cadets of Himachal Pradesh, who are getting training at National Defence Academy (NDA), Khadakwasla, Pune. Rates of Scholarship * Income Group * Low Middle High Particulars Initial Lump-sum clothing Grant per Cadet Rs 3000/- Rs 2250/- Rs 1500/- Pocket Allowance per Cadet for each of the Six semesters of 1st to 3rd year Rs 1500/-(per Semester) Rs 1200/-(per Semester) Rs 900/-(per Semester) Total Amount Rs 12000/- Rs 9450/- Rs 6900/- The printed copy of the Online Scholarship Form (after successful online submission of form), along with all requisite documents, needs to be submitted by the student to his / her Head of the Institute, who will retain it in the institution. The Institution will forward the duly attested printed form (after successful online verification) along with the Verified Candidate List(s) (on the prescribed format) to this Directorate, for online verification & safekeeping. In case, any offline application form is received by the Head of the Institute, he / she is directed to return the same to the concerned student, at his / her own level; & to direct the sender to fill the form online & submit the printed copy of the Online Application Form, afterwards, through the same channel. Scheme Specific Document(s) Required: 1. Passport Size Photo. 2. AADHAAR Card(UID / EID No). 3. Himachali Bonafide Certificate. 4. Previous Year(s) Result Card(s) from Matric onwards. 5. Latest Bank Statement of the Students Bank Account. 6. Income Certificate of Parent / Guardian (Issued by an officer not below the rank of Tehsildar).
title: NDA Scholarship Scheme(Only for NDA Khadakwasla).
documents: Previous Year(s) Result Card(s) from Matric onwards
Latest Bank Statement of the Students Bank Account

description: Children of Armed Forces Personnel killed / disabled in the different wars /operations are eligible for this assistance. In case of disability is below 50%, the children will get half scholarship. The Dy. Director,Sainik Welfare Board of the respective district would be the Regulating Authority for this Scheme. Rates of Scholarship Class Boys Girls 9th & 10th Rs 300/-p.a. Rs 600/-p.a. +1 & +2 Rs 800/-p.a. Rs 800/-p.a. College/University i)Day scholar Rs 1200/-p.a. Rs 1200/-p.a. ii)Hostelers Rs 2400/-p.a. Rs 2400/-p.a. The printed copy of the Online Scholarship Form (after successful online submission of form), along with all requisite documents, needs to be submitted by the student to his / her Head of the Institute, who will retain it in the institution. The Institution will forward the duly attested printed form (after successful online verification) along with the Verified Candidate List(s) (on the prescribed format) to the concerned Dy. Director, Sainik Welfare Board, of the respective district. After successful online verification by the Dy. Director, Sainik Welfare Board, he/she needs to forward the original form(s) received from the schools along with the Verified Candidate List(s), to this Directorate, for online verification & safekeeping. In case, any offline application form is received by the Head of the Institute / Dy. Director, Sainik Welfare Board, he / she is directed / requested to return the same to the concerned student, at his / her own level;& to direct the sender to fill the form online & submit the printed copy of the Online Application Form, afterwards, through the same channel. Scheme Specific Document(s) Required: 1. Passport Size Photo. 2. AADHAAR Card(UID / EID No). 3. Himachali Bonafide Certificate. 4. Previous Year(s) Result Card(s). 5. Latest Bank Statement of the Students Bank Account.

description: Scholarships for PG/Degree & Engg Level Courses based on Poverty-cum-Brillance and Brilliance. Students must be Bonafide Himachali and ward of H.P. Govt. employees.  Income limit of Rs. 36,000 p.a. for parents/guardian. Minimum 60% marks required (except for SC/ST students).

title: Scholarships for PG/Degree & Engg Level Courses.
funding_pattern: Rs. 300/- p.m. for General category (PG/Degree), Rs. 500/- p.m. for SC/ST students (PG/Degree), Rs. 200/- p.m. for Diploma students (including SC/ST)
